content: Yes, I can provide information on the recent upgrades on the Northern Line's trains. In 2014, Transport for London (TfL) began upgrading the Northern Line rolling stock, replacing the existing fleet of 47-year-old trains with new, more modern models. The new trains have several upgrades, including air conditioning, wider doors, walk-through carriages, and improved accessibility for passengers with disabilities. Additionally, the new trains have a higher capacity, as they are longer than the previous ones, and are expected to carry up to 25% more passengers.
